question: Which country recently held parliamentary elections, amid the Covid-19 pandemic?
explanation:
South Korea recently held the parliamentary elections of the country, amid the Covid-19 pandemic, becoming one of the first countries to hold election, after the pandemic began.
On the day of election, the total number of positive cases in South Korea was 10,564, according to the Korea Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. The self-quarantined citizens were allowed to vote after the other voters left. All voters are made to maintain safety measures while waiting to vote.
